title.narrative: Supporting Freedom of Religious Belief in Nigeria’s Middle belt

description.narrative:
First, the project will examine the enablers (legal, political and religious), barriers (institutional and structural influences), and challenges (economic, and social) to Freedom of Religious Belief in Kaduna State. As referenced in Bishop Truro’s report, Nigeria’s Middle Belt has experienced an upsurge in religious violence, with people killed and places of worship burned. With deep and widespread participation from communities and key stakeholders, tangible recommendations on how the FCO can support enablers and overcome barriers and challenges at local, state and federal level will be proposed and validated.
CAFOD will recruit a seasoned consultant who will work closely with the Research Assistance to conduct the research. The Peace building and Governance Programme Officer would provide remote support to the process. About 20 enumerators will participate in the data collection for about 4 days. Then the recommendations would be validated with the stakeholders before the final report is submitted to CAFOD.
CAFOD anticipates that the findings from the research would be used to address some of the challenges facing those communities.
